definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: It was always the first thing to do in the early morning to appreciate each ice paint on window.
sentences.chinese: 那时每天早上的第一件事情便是欣赏窗上的冰花。

sentences.english: In the fine gold beautiful jade fire burns, in the wonderful ice flowers snow carves.
sentences.chinese: 精金美玉火中烧，美妙冰花雪里雕。

sentences.english: Rose up in the morning, found that window has a layer of ice.
sentences.chinese: 早晨起来，发现窗子上已经结了一层冰花。

sentences.english: Thus, molecule by molecule the ice flowers begin to take shape.
sentences.chinese: 随后，这些分子就慢慢形成冰花的形状。

sentences.english: So, does the beachgrass simply outcompete the lupines for land and light?
sentences.chinese: 这些滨草单单是为了夺取鲁冰花生长的土地和阳光么？

sentences.english: Down in the hollows and along the stone walls grew the beautiful flowers.
sentences.chinese: 连空地上和高高的石墙下面，都开满了美丽的鲁冰花。

definition: frost forming a pattern on a surface/rime
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
(of mist, snow, floodwater etc) a vast expanse of whiteness
to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
